document.docAuthor: Brescovit, Antonio D., Ruiz, Alexander Sánchez & Garcia, Giraldo Alayón
document.docTitle: Antilloides zozo Brescovit, Ruiz & Garcia, 2016, new species
document.masterDocTitle: The Filistatidae in the Caribbean region, with a description of the new genus Antilloides, revision of the genus Filistatoides F. O. P. - Cambridge and notes on Kukulcania Lehtinen (Arachnida, Araneae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Filistatidae in the Caribbean region, with a description of the new genus Antilloides, revision of the genus Filistatoides F. O. P. - Cambridge and notes on Kukulcania Lehtinen (Arachnida, Araneae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types .
Holotype male and paratype female from Drunk Bay (
18 ° 18 ' 37 "N
64 ° 42 ' 9 "W
), Saint John , U. S. Virgin Islands ,
18 .VI. 1980
, W. B. Muchmore col., deposited in FSCA .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 17A‒E.
Antilloides mesoliticus
n. sp.
, male from Isla Juventud, Cuba, A. habitus, dorsal. B. Female from same place, habitus. C. Male palp, prolateral. D. Same, retrolateral. E. Spermathecae, dorsal. Abbreviations: cd = neck; r = receptacula; ue = uterus externus.

FIGURE 18A‒D.
Antilloides zozo
n. sp.
, male (Holotype). A. Habitus, dorsal. B. Female (Paratype), habitus dorsal. C. Male palp, prolateral. D. Same, retrolateral.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Other material examined. U. S. VIRGIN ISLANDS .
Saint John
: Drunk Bay (
18 ° 18 ' 37 "N
64 ° 42 ' 9 "W
) (under low shrubs), 2 ♀ 4 imm.,
18 .VI. 1980
, W.B. Muchmore col. ( FSCA ); Ditto, 1 ♀ ( IBSP 166723 ). PUERTO RICO . Guánica : Bosque Estatal de Guánica (
17 ° 57 ' 56 "N
66 ° 52 ' 45 "W
) 1 Ƌ 1 imm.,
4 .II. 2012
, A. Sánchez col. ( IBSP 166724 ); Mayagüez : Mona Island , Cave Cae Oro Cae (
18 ° 5 ' 9 "N
67 ° 56 ' 19 "W
), 12 ♀ 5 imm., no date, I. Agnarsson Team col. ( NMNH ); Cueva Linos, 6 ♀ 2 imm., no date, CarBio Team col. ( NMNH ).
Etymology . The specific name is an arbitrary combination of letters.

Diagnosis .
Antilloides zozo
n. sp.
is distinguished from other species by having the tibiae as long as the cymbium and the embolus very slender at the tip (
Figs 18 C‒D
,
19 A‒F
; 21 D‒E). The females differ from other species by the short uterus externus that does not exceed the height of the spermathecae (
Fig. 21 F
).

Description . Male ( Holotype ). Carapace orange, with black border and a black spot behind ocular area. Chelicerae, labium, endites and sternum orange. Palp and legs orange with sparse greenish bands. Abdomen orange, dorsally with 6–7 black chevrons ( 18 A). Total length 1.8 . Carapace length 0.8 , width 0.6 . PME separated by their diameters. Palp measurements: femur 0.9 long, patella 0.4 long, tibia 3.0 long, 0.2 wide. Leg measurements: I femur 1.0/ patella 0.4 / tibia 1.1 / metatarsus 0.9 / tarsus 0.6 / total 4.0; II 0.6 / 0.4 / other articles lacking; III 0.6 / 0.3 / 0.9 / 0.8 / 0.6 / 3.2 ; IV 0.8 / 0.4 / 0.8 / 0.9 / 0.5 / 3.4 . Palp: tibiae longer than cymbium, with two long tibial spines, lyriform organs subdistal; cymbium with long distal spine; embolus longer that cymbium and with a very narrow tip (
Figs 19 A‒H
,
21 D‒E
). Abdomen 1.0 long.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 19A‒H.
Antilloides zozo
n. sp.
, male palp (Guanica, Puerto Rico). A. Prolateral. B. Retrolateral. C. Cymbium, distal area, prolateral. D. Tibial spines, detail, retrolateral. E. Dosral. F. Cymbium and embolus, detail, dorsal. G. Tibiae, lyriform organs, retrolateral. H. Same, prolateral.

FIGURE 20A‒G. A‒C.
Antilloides abeli
n. sp.
(Pinar de Rio, near Dos Hermanos, Cuba). A. Male palp, retrolateral. B. Same, prolateral. C. Spermathecae, dorsal. D.
Antilloides cubitas
n. sp.
(Sierra Cubitas , Camaguey, Cuba), spermathecae, dorsal. E–G.
Antilloides haitises
n. sp.
(Holotype NMNH). E. Male palp, prolateral. F. Same, retrolateral. G. Spermathecae (Paratype NMNH), dorsal. Abbreviations: cy = cymbium; e = embolus; cd = neck; r = receptacula; sp = modified spines; ue = uterus externus.

FIGURE 21A‒F. A‒C.
Antilloides mesoliticus
n. sp.
(Isla Juventud, Cuba). A. Male palp, prolateral. B. Same, retrolateral. C. Spermathecae, dorsal. D‒F.
Antilloides zozo
n. sp.
(Holotype). D. Male palp, prolateral. E. Same, retrolateral. F. Spermathecae (Paratype), dorsal. Abbreviations: cd = neck; r = receptacula; ue = uterus externus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Natural history . Specimens from Saint John ( USVI ) were collected in litter, under cactus or under low shrubs. Distribution. Known from U. S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico (
Fig. 22
A).
